Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Home_Create .NET apps faster with NuGet_ColorContrast :The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background is 2.81:1 which less than 3:1." (#8987) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468969

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL:https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer/
2. Tab to the tap navigation
3. Run the Accessibility insights for web 
4. Check the color contrast for the selected items 

The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background is 2.81:1 which less than 3:1.

Similar issue is observed in the scenario given below:
- Account_ForgotPassword - focus boundary for 'Send' button.

### Expected Behavior

The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background must be equal to or greater than 3:1.

Similar issue is observed in through out the application

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: [A11y] NuGetServiceMicrosoft.Data.SqlClient: Ensures elements have alternate text or a role of none or presentation" (#9036) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: ### Impact It's more difficult to complete my work ### Describe the bug Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468388 ### Repro Steps 1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Data.SqlClient/ 2. Tab to the Used by 3. Run the Accessibility insights for web Similar issue is observed in the following scenarios: Profile-Used by Profile-Json Bson Profile-AWSSDK Profile-AutoMapper Profile-NUnit ### Expected Behavior Ensures elements have alternate text or a role of none or presentation (image-alt - https://accessibilityinsights.io/info-examples/web/image-alt) Target application: NuGet Gallery | Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.0.1 - https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Data.SqlClient/ Element path: tr:nth-child(2) > .used-by-desc-column > .reserved-indicator[title=""] Snippet: ### Screenshots _No response_ ### Additional Context and logs _No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer_ColorContrast :The color contrast ratio of the focus on the item in the top navigation is 2.061:1 which less than 3:1" (#8986) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468939

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer/
2. Tab to the tap navigation
3. Run the Accessibility insights for web 
4. Check the color contrast for the selected items 

The color contrast ratio of the focus on the top selected item in the navigation is 2.061:1 which less than 3:1

Similar issue is observed in throughout the application for all the items in the navigation bar and controls that have a black focus outline with blue background

### Expected Behavior

The color contrast ratio for the focus must be 3:1 or greater

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Added aria-label attributes to table elements" (#9043) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/9042

**Problem:**

In the Package Details page's 'Used By' tab, the Dependent Packages table did not have an aria-label attribute that would allow screen readers to read its name.

Previous version: (See the "Name" attribute on the right side of the image)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/157749939-45d7e9b7-836f-47f1-9992-8a136e6adb6c.png)

**Fix:**

To fix this, I added the aria-label attribute to the table element here, as well as other table elements where I noticed the issue.

After the changes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/157749199-49385c76-caf2-477a-9460-398c4d971534.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.03.10]RI of dev into main" (#9045) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.03.10]RI of dev into main" (#9045) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[2FA] Enforce 2FA for new accounts." (#9035) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- All new accounts will be enforced to use 2FA.
- If a current user wants to link/replace to a new MSA/AAD account, 2FA will be enforced.
- Enable/Disable button for changing 2FA status on Account Settings page will only show Enable so users can still follow that flow if they want to enable it before enforcement.
- All these changes are hidden using the `NewAccount2FAEnforcement` feature flag.
- Fix bug where gallery didn't use MSA/AAD 2FA info to add the value to `EnableMultiFactorAuthentication` when an account was created (only happened the next time the user logs).

Addresses:
- https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4235
- https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4236

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Add a "+" for NuGet Compatible Frameworks Badges" (#9044) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

_No response_

### The Elevator Pitch

If a package supports more than 1 target framework in a specific .NET category, it should include a "+" sign next to it's badge at the top of the package details page.

Example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1288848/157750753-357675ae-4034-4752-951c-259076ee6bba.png)

Has more than 1 target framework in two different categories and thus should show `.NET Standard 1.0+` and `.NET Framework 2.0+`.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/9042

**Problem:**

In the Package Details page's 'Used By' tab, the Dependent Packages table did not have an aria-label attribute that would allow screen readers to read its name.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Added alt text to reserved namespace icon on package details page" (#9041) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9036

**Problem:**

In the Package Details page's 'Used By' tab, the 'reserved namespace' icons next to the Package Dependents did not have alt attributes.

Previous version:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/157561027-35f0bf2b-182b-427f-93c9-893623193477.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/157561109-7bc0d30d-a780-45af-83ae-716a33b443cd.png)

**Fix:**

To fix this, I added the alt attribute to the reserved namespace img element.

After the changes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/157560972-4dc54599-1207-4404-8b12-e3e08d8d8d3e.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: .NET Restore on MacOS prefixes filenames with foldernames instead of placing in subfolders" (#11667) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.200

### Worked before?

Not sure

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

From commandline on MacOS run:

```
mkdir test
cd test
dotnet new console
dotnet add ./ package MSTextX.UnitTestRunner --version 2.0.0-preview1
```
Open up the nuget cache folder `~/.nuget/packages/mstestx.unittestrunner/2.0.0-preview1`
Notice that instead of files being in a folder structure, they are all in the same folder with their folder names prefixing the filenames and backslashes in the name:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1378165/157795207-629bed61-3abe-4390-af4e-83630e107f35.png)

Repeat the same with v1.4.0 of the same nuget package, and you'll see a more meaningful folder layout:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1378165/157795255-5ff16b35-bd1d-4d72-bdd9-01f74f554429.png)

Repeat the same thing on Windows, and there is no issue and the nupkg gets unzipped correctly. I didn't find anything obviously different about the two packages.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'dotnet nuget push' any value not immediately associated with other options automatically become part of paths" (#11631) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow up on https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11601.
If I do `dotnet nuget push *.nupkg -n az contoso -s Test` then here `az`, `contoso` become part of paths besides `*.nupkg`.
It's quite implicit and confusing for end users, end up with `error: File does not exist az`

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/cd865352-6251-4020-baad-5a34e151cb1d)

Not sure what would be best course of action here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).
